text:
Autonomous Runet and changes in the work of MFIs: what awaits Russians in November 2019
01 Nov 2019, 18:00 by Natalya Kopylova
Most regulations come into force on the 1st.
The property
Recently, electronic signatures (EF) scams have become more frequent. Attackers faked or stole them, executed transactions * with real estate under fictitious agreements, and then registered everything with the Rosreestr. * Source: Electronic villainy: how to lose housing in one click
From August 13, it is impossible to register the transfer of ownership only with an electronic signature *. Before that, by default it was believed that you were not against such a situation. And if it‚Äôs still against, it was necessary to file an application in which you prohibit the use of electronic signature for these purposes. Now the opposite is true: if you want Rosreestr to register transactions with an electronic signature, you need to notify him about it. * Source: Federal Law of 02.08.2019 N 286-–§–ó
The new law *, which is effective from November 1, introduces additional protection. When the documents for registration of the transfer of ownership of the dwelling with EP are received at Rosreestr, the owner will be informed about this. If a person has not executed any contracts, the agency will find out about this and the fraudsters will not be able to get an apartment. * Source: Federal Law of 02.08.2019 N 286-–§–ó
Finance
Until November 1, any person could take up to 200 thousand rubles on credit in a microfinance organization (MFI) on the security of an apartment. If the debtor did not return the money, MFI representatives could have taken away * his housing. * Source: The family lost a five-room apartment due to microloans
To prevent this from happening, the authorities banned * MFIs from issuing loans secured by real estate. Now they can be taken only for entrepreneurial activity. * Source: Federal Law of 02.08.2019 N 271-–§–ó
Communication
On November 1, the law on the autonomous Runet enters into force. It is ambiguous. Some perceive it as a way to protect traffic in Russia from external cyber threats. Others - like creating a ‚Äúcircuit breaker‚Äù that will isolate the Runet from the World Wide Web. And in general, both positions are true, but the law, rather, has touched the future. * Source: Federal Law of 01.05.2019 N 90-–§–ó
Here is what awaits users in the near future, when special equipment for locking traffic within the country will be installed:

Network Failures. A separate line in the law states that no one bears responsibility for them and there will be no one to ask for it.
Test outages.

However, most likely, we are talking about isolated cases. So far, the law brings new troubles only to telecom operators.
Learn more üßê


How autonomous Runet will work and how it threatens users


Transport
Starting November 1, tachographs * must be installed in trucks heavier than 3.5 tons and buses. These are devices with which you can monitor how much the driver is working and resting. In transport owned by organizations and entrepreneurs, they were mandatory before. Now this requirement is presented to everyone. * Source: Decree of the Government of the Russian Federation of September 30, 2019 N 1276 ‚ÄúOn Amending the Rules for the Technical Inspection of Vehicles‚Äù
Without a tachograph, inspection will not work. If he is not, the offender can be fined 3-5 thousand rubles, if we are talking about an individual. And the driver will have to comply * with labor and rest standards. In a five-day period, he is allowed to work no more than 8 hours a day, in a six-day period - 7 hours. In the case of a shift schedule, you can work 10 or 12 hours (in exceptional cases). Rest times are also regulated. A person will be fined 2,000 for violating these standards. * Source: Order of the Ministry of Transport of Russia of 08.20.2004 No. 15
Tourism
From November 1, the legislation officially fixes * the status of a pilgrim. From now on, he is a person who travels to visit places of religious veneration and participate in religious rites and ceremonies. A pilgrimage trip can last from one day to 6 months. * Source: Federal Law of 03.07.2019 N 170-–§–ó
Pilgrimage trips can be done independently or through religious organizations. The latter, in turn, can attract travel agencies or make money on pilgrims on their own.
Pilgrimage is not considered tourism, and the laws of this industry do not apply to it. If something goes wrong, no one will give you traditional guarantees.
At the same time, tourist organizations will no longer be able to arrange pilgrimage trips, although it is not prohibited to visit sacred places during ordinary holidays. But you have to look and behave in accordance with the principles of a religious cult.
Citizenship
A residence permit will become * perpetual. Previously, the document was issued for 5 years, and then it had to be renewed. But at the same time, the state duty also increased - from 3.5 to 5 thousand rubles. An exception is made for foreign highly qualified specialists and members of their families. They still receive a residence permit for the duration of their work permit. * Source: Federal Law of 02.08.2019 N 257-–§–ó
In addition, now a document can immediately be obtained without a residence permit:

Citizens born on the territory of the RSFSR and who had in the past Soviet citizenship.
Deported from the territory of the Crimean ASSR and their relatives.
Children born in Russia, adopted by foreigners.

State support
Starting November 2, age restrictions on participation in the Zemsky Doctor and Zemsky Paramedic programs are canceled *. Earlier, a specialist younger than 50 years old could receive a monetary reward for moving to the countryside. Now 1 million rubles will be given to a doctor of any age. The medical assistant is entitled to 500 thousand. * Source: Decree of the Government of the Russian Federation of 10/18/2019
State control
Starting November 1, finished dairy products must be accompanied by * electronic veterinary certificates. Documents are drawn up in the Mercury system. Thanks to it, you can track data about the product and the way it moves from production to the point of sale. * Source: Order of the Ministry of Agriculture of the Russian Federation of April 15, 2019 No. 193
